Our Ideal Candidate
Qualifications

Domain Knowledge

Attention to detail
Curiosity
High degree of responsibility
Self-motivated, requiring minimal supervision
Structure and discipline
Good written communication skills
Able to challenge/ question 
Most roles will be ‘individual contributors’. Senior data analyst may be required to lead 2 - 3 direct reports (if required to).

Requirements:
The candidate, who has strong enthusiasm in metabolic diseases, hematology and vascular biology, will be actively involved in the development of our research program. His/her responsibilities will include:
• Mouse colony management, including mouse breeding and genotyping
• Procurement and purchasing of equipment, materials, consumables and mice, etc.
• Establishing and maintaining laboratory records (including SOPs and safety), and inventories of chemicals, antibodies, etc.
• Stocking laboratory supplies, aliquoting antibodies and reagents for investigator use, and providing general support to the laboratory
• Maintaining equipment, laboratory area and supplies in a neat and professional manner
• Assisting other team members in experiments (e.g., specimen fixation, tissue sectioning, histology, Western blotting, etc.), documenting results, and analysing data
• Cultivating and maintaining cell lines
• Participating in regular laboratory meetings and discussions
• Interested candidate may have opportunities to hold independent projects.
The candidate should have the following qualifications and skills:
• Bachelor of Science in Life Sciences, Biomedical Sciences, or related disciplines
• At least one-year of relevant research laboratory experience
• Experience and comfort in mouse experimentation and husbandry
• Experience in tissue histology (e.g., sample sectioning and staining)
• Experience in benchwork including biochemical and molecular assays
• Prior knowledge of cell culture
• Well-organized and attentive to details
• Be able to set priorities, think critically, and enjoy troubleshooting
• Be able to work independently and responsibly, as well as a proactive team player with excellent communication (oral and written) and interpersonal skills
• Applicants who have experience in laboratory management (e.g., administrative tasks including procurement and maintaining laboratory SOPs) are especially encouraged to apply.
  Application Procedure:
If you are interested to pursue a career with the School, please apply via APPLY NOW button below with your cover letter, CV, list of publications (if applicable), a 1-page summary of previous research experience (scientific and/or administrative), and names/contact details of two references at your earliest convenience. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Title: Fullstack Engineer-100E (AI Singapore)

Company: WOOD MACKENZIE ASIA PACIFIC PTE. LTD.
Requirements:
We are looking for a Research Manager – South East Asia Oil & Gas to join our Upstream team in Singapore. This is a critical regional leadership role with tremendous growth potential in the oil & gas space.
Our dedicated oil and gas sector teams are located around the world, and deliver research and consulting projects based on our assessment and valuation of thousands of individual assets. Together we work with a range of clients including national and major oil companies, operators, investment banks and institutional investors.
About you and how you can excel in this role
You understand the value of data for business decision-making and want to work in a leading research, analytics and consultancy organisation.  You are passionate about leadership and excellence.   
You have an analytical, commercial mindset and can formulate leading-edge analysis from a variety of data and information. This is coupled with your ability to communicate highly complex or technical information, delivering messages that are easily understood. You have a good understanding of the energy and/or resources sector gained in previous roles.  
You are keen to develop your management skills, having previously led or informally coached a small to mid-sized team. Playing a part in setting the business priorities, including the technical direction of your team is important to you in how you lead, evaluate and develop your team of professionals.
You have a proven track record of fostering strong working relationships including coaching, influencing and developing others around you. The way in which you work is highly productive and driven, striving to be best in class and setting the standard for others to follow. You are focused on continuous improvement and play a key role in implementing better ways of working.
Title: Research Manager

Requirements:
Attitudes & Behaviours Critical to Success:
To be successful in this role, you should possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy and have a passion for continuous improvement and a strong customer focus. In addition to focusing on flawless execution, you will have high energy, intellectual curiosity and proven track record of delivering results. You will have demonstrated:
Perseverance. Building a great company that customers love is hard work. Many challenges await and we are looking for team members we can count on when things get tough.
High business Impact. We are results oriented. We value people who focus on the right things and get them done.
Experience in developing in-house HR and/ or Finance technology solutions, including working with external vendors on microservice, cloud-based and open-source solutions.
Strong Project Management & Business Analyst experience, to translate client needs into tangible solutions.
Hands-on approach to develop in-house software solutions as well as integrations with COTS systems, and able to work within a larger technology team to project manage development.
Track-record of successfully delivering projects in HR Technology.
You have a strong systems thinking perspective and have creative problem solving and analytical skills.
Qualifications and Requirements:
Graduate degree in Computer Science disciplines or equivalent experience.
Experience and strong interest in HR Technology is essential.
Project management experience, with good understanding of Agile methods.
Data analytics skills that allows you to work closely with client groups on developing and presenting relevant data sets and reporting dashboards.
Able to work independently and with minimal supervision.
Strong coding skills. Development experience in UI and backend. Experience with Java, SQL, Tableau.
Startup experience in setting up softwares and new technologies is a plus.
Title: Senior Software Engineer - People Initiatives

Requirements:
Skills sets:   
•      All engineers should have Enterprise Wired & Wireless network experience either on Cisco / Alcatel. •     Engineer must have onsite operational support experience in large campus / enterprise - Wired Wireless & Data centre network environments. •     All Engineer must have knowledge in network scripting. •     Senior Engineer must have network device backup scripting knowledge on Unix / Linux OS. •      Engineer should have knowledge about Network Layer 1 technologies and should have the know ledge in Cable tester (fibre and copper) for troubleshooting. •      Engineer need to provide 24/7 support when needed. •     All Engineers should take lead in handling complex issue and identify root cause. •    All Engineers must be capable of mounting switches and carry weighted equipment. •    All Engineers should have experience in structure cabling technologies and data centre cabling methodologies. •    All Engineer should be physically fit and experienced to work at height up to three (3) meters. •    All Engineers should have knowledge in tracing cable and Network device power requirements. •    All Engineers should have good knowledge in project management and vendor management. •    All Engineers must have above average command of the English language, both written and spoken. •    All Engineers must be able to speak confidently and able to conduct presentations. •    Basic Knowledge about servers (Wintel and Linux and virtualization) is beneficial. •    All Engineers must have experience working with Cisco N9K, C-3560, C3560X, C-3650, C-6500 and Alcatel 6K switches. •   All engineers must be experienced in dealing with Cisco/Alcatel TAC case escalation and reporting. •    All Engineers are proficiency in IP subnetting, OSPF, BGP, STP, VTP, SNMP, QOS, HSRP, VPC, VRF, DNS, DHCP, Linux and Microsoft OS is a must. •    All Engineers should track the Cisco and Alcatel security Vulnerability reports and provide the fix. •    All Engineers must have good understanding of network technologies like advanced IP Routing, Switching and Wireless network on both Alcatel and Cisco campus network devices. •    All Engineers must have hand on experience in Cisco prime, Cisco ACS, Alcatel Airwave •    All Engineers must have knowledge in syslog message extraction and corelation tools 
•   Senior Engineers (CCNP) should have experience in wireless site survey application and Wireless network optimization. Junior Engineers (CCNA) is advantageous. •    Senior Engineers (CCNP) must be proficient in Wireless network issue analysis and troubleshooting with relevant tools like Air-magnet Wi-Fi analyser, Air-magnet Spectrum Analyzer and Wi-Fi Wireshark capturing and must be able to analyse the data using the tools. Junior Engineers (CCNA) is advantageous. •   All senior Engineers (CCNP) should have the experience in high-level troubleshooting skills on wireless network issues. •    All Engineers should have experience and high-level knowledge in ITIL process and service management. •    All Engineers must have ITIL foundation certified. •    All Engineers must be able to produce technical documentation and system/network diagrams using Microsoft Office programs and Microsoft Visio. •    All Engineers must be proficient in using network analyser/sniffing tools such as Sniffer, Wireshark and Ethereal for troubleshooting network issues. They must able to understand packet dumps/traces produced by such tools.

Helping clients to navigate and extract data from the S&P Global Platts product range.

With more than 190,000 people, the Capgemini group (https://www.capgemini.com/) is present in over 40 countries. A global leader in consulting, technology and outsourcing services for more than 50 years, the Group reported global revenues of EUR 12.5 billion in 2016 (2017 figures pending). Together with its clients, Capgemini creates and delivers business, technology and digital solutions that fit their needs, enabling them to achieve innovation and competitiveness.
  Capgemini Singapore (https://www.sg.capgemini.com/) has been operating in the country since 1991 and is the regional base for Capgemini operations in South East Asia and Japan.
  Capgemini Singapore is looking for interns to join our legal department this summer. Applicants should be rising third or fourth year law students who want to experience working in an in-house environment, and in particular those who may be keen to pursue a technology/IP based practice in future. Knowledge of IP and/or TMT law is preferred but not essential.
  Support Capgemini lawyers in day-to-day legal work, including both transactional and regulatory work involving contract law, information technology, data privacy, intellectual property, competition law, and employment law matters.
Support any ad-hoc legal projects, including researching and drafting legal memoranda, and reviewing templates.
Assist Capgemini lawyers in preparing for, and conducting, internal training programs.
Plan, research, and draft legal outreach articles for the benefit of our business, sales, and delivery teams.
    Internship period:
  Four to six weeks
  Allowance:
  SGD 900 per month on a pro-rated basis
  Application pre-requisites:
  Please provide us with a copy of your CV and transcript.
Please provide us your preferred window period for the internship.

Production managers ensure that manufacturing processes run reliably and efficiently.

planning and organising production schedules

supervising the work of junior staff
organising relevant training sessions
Study energy usage patterns and find ways to save energy.

Suggested application requirements
Below are the attributes and skills we look for in candidates, but don’t be discouraged if you don’t possess all or even most of them. We would still love to talk to you about joining our team.

an analytical software (e.g. R, SAS);
a data visualization tool (e.g. Qlikview, Tableau, PowerBI,);
a relational or graph database management tool (e.g. SQL, NoSQL, Neo4J);

Categories: Architecture / Interior Design, Building and Construction, Engineering, Information Technology
Requirements:
Responsibilities
Our consultants are responsible for providing professional services to PTS’ clients throughout strategy, design, procurement and implementation stages of projects.
For this specific role the Project Manager is responsible for providing professional services to PTS’ clients throughout the strategy, design coordination and implementation stages of the projects.
The Physical Infrastructure Project Management Consultant will be responsible for:
• Define the project plan and deliverables; manage scope, cost, quality, risk and issues of the project; manage budget, forecast and related financial reporting of the project
• Working with an international team of peers to deliver a Singapore project for a world-renowned client
• Raise resource demand and ensure timely onboarding of team
• Track project milestones and review deliverables to ensure on-time and high-quality delivery
• Ensure the system transition into operations to comply with business requirements, regulations, internal control, standards, and is operable
• Tracking status of project deliverables and milestones
• Risk and issue monitoring and coordination
• Coordination of the regular project and programme level reporting
Coordination of project governance arrangements
• Manage the collection, collation and processing of project information from stakeholders
• Monitor and report on budgets and expenditure
• Assist with the implementation of project standards across projects
• Managing and updating project documentation, process documents and information sources
• Managing an IT Infrastructure and Data Centre project end-to-end; from initiation, understanding & requirements gathering, internal & external communication, meeting & project coordination pre/post/during construction periods including representation during construction meetings and reporting, through to testing & commissioning, etc.
• Creating or contributing to IT Infrastructure and Data Centre-related PTS document issuance
• Increasing business opportunities through various routes to market
• Understanding the local and global IT Infrastructure and Data Centre delivery capability of PTS
• Understanding and report market conditions and competitor activity
• Maintaining a self-development program
• Representing PTS to the public, key stakeholders, executive management, business partners and clients
In addition to delivery responsibilities, the Physical Infrastructure Project Management Consultant is expected to:
• Have strong organisational and communication skills
• Project manage a team of consultants or vendors across multiple technology disciplines
• Have excellent interpersonal skills
• Be able to command and empathise with both internal and client teams
• Manage multiple simultaneous assignments and clients
Characteristics & Skills
• Collaborate with other PTS teams (global offices) and service lines so that a united PTS can provide a complete IP-based intelligent building proposition Characteristics & Skills
• Experienced and eager to engage with both the PTS team and its clients
• A self-motivated individual that can work both in isolation and in a team as necessary with effective time management
• Asserts ownership of projects/tasks to ensure completion within the applied constraints
• Able to compile reports and project documentation to a high standard
• Unafraid to attempt new work outside of their normal “comfort-zone” Experience and Certifications
Experience and Certifications
Applicants must be able to demonstrate the following:
A background in IT Infrastructure and Data Centre consultancy or Project management with any design works, including but not limited to: proposals, project management including design coordination with other designers to establish integrated solutions
• Have experience providing designs across the various IT Infrastructure and Data Centre platforms
• At least 7-10 years of experience with designing physical data centres covering copper/fibre cabling, route design, racking, coordination with both internal & external parties
• A sound knowledge of copper and fibre optic data transmission techniques
• Degree in IT-related discipline or relevant experience
• Efficient in Project Management tools and able to demonstrate
• A demonstrable passion for technology
• Excellent spoken and written English
• Able to travel Asia-wide

What we look for
Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. What working at EY offers

The successful candidate will be pro-active and able to work independently. You will work
closely with the Business Development team and play a pivotal role in shaping the current
and future product roadmap of GoBear in Singapore and other countries. You will help lead
every facet of the product journey, including positioning the new and existing products,
providing competitive product analysis, keeping data up to date and bear responsibility for
the pricing and monitoring.

- Responsible for product research and comparisons for new and existing GoBear
products
- Responsible for crafting product requirements in developing new products, working
with Business Development team to gather requirements from partners, and with
Consumer team to gather insights from users to draft product requirements
- Initiate suggestions and provide actionable insights using data to improve existing
products
- Support GoBear’s overseas companies and branches for product research and
launch of new products and maintenance of existing products
- Provide trainings to country teams for new or improved products
- Be informed on the latest market developments regarding finance and insurance
across the region
- Assist with product operations where required
- Work hands-on and share knowledge and product learnings between team members
and markets
- Complete ad-hoc projects and tasks as required
Requirements
This technology start-up requires an experienced an assertive and hands-on Regional
Product Specialist. We are looking for the following qualifications and skills;
GoBear Page 2 of 2 v1.0
- Minimum Bachelor degree in finance, marketing or business management
- Minimum 2 years’ working experience in the banking / finance or insurance industry
- Extensive knowledge of local banking and/or insurance products is a must
- Existing network or excellent working knowledge of partners in either insurance and
banking industry in one or more markets GoBear operates in.
- Experience with online business or working in a regional team is a bonus
- Knowledge of Google Analytics
- Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
- Proficient oral and written communication in English. Knowledge of other languages
such as Bahasa, Vietnamese, Thai, or Mandarin is a plus.
Attitude & Characteristics
- Ability and desire to work in a fast-paced environment with ever changing priorities
- Solution-driven
- Meticulous and have an eye for detail
- Ability to think strategically and have big picture view
- Ability to work collaboratively
- Good time management and prioritization skills
- Willing to go the extra mile

Requirements:
What fun you’ll get to have at GoBear?

 You will take lead on designing, implementing, and managing sales forecasting, demand management,
planning and control
 You will create impressive dashboards that provide (real time) insights to improve the performance of
the sales teams active in 7 countries
 You will be responsible for establishing high levels of quality, accuracy, and process consistency in
planning, forecasting, and budgeting approaches used by the sales organization
 You will ensure planning, forecasting and budgeting efforts are appropriately integrated with other
planning processes employed within the company
 You will work closely with the sales leaders to define the optimal performance measurements and
performance management programs required to ensure sales organisation’s success
 You will take ownership of providing leadership consultation to the sales organization, and counsel to
the Country Directors and their business development teams, in implementing sales organisation
objectives that appropriately reflect the company’s business goals
 You will partner with senior sales leadership to identify opportunities for sales process improvement
 You will facilitates successful implementation of new programs through the sales organization by
ensuring a well-defined, efficient sales process is in place for launch
 You will prioritize investments in enabling technologies in support of sales organisation productivity
 You will partner with the CCO & CPO to understand company’s sales and technology strategy and
recommend changes and enhancements to the company Customer Relationship Management
technology platform (Salesforce)
Got Skills?
 You have a minimum bachelor’s degree in a related field, preferably finance or business; MBA would be
highly preferred
 You bring in overall 10+ years of work experience, with 5+ years of Sales Operations specific experience
 You have preferably worked in financial services, FinTech or e-commerce industries
 You have above average interpersonal and organisational skills and are comfortable to work in a matrix
organisation structure
 You bring in expert knowledge of CRM tools like Salesforce
 You have above par English language skills (spoken and written)
 You are an expert in MS Excel and know how to deploy BI tools like Tableau or Klipfolio
 It’ll be great if you have knowledge of personal financial products
Does this sound like you?
 You have the ability to drive and implement insights in a challenging environment
 You are highly analytical & sales focused
 You are a collaborator, able to partner with C-level & Country Directors
 You are able to build and manage a team

Who are we?
Tigerspike is a digital products company improving people’s lives through technology. Focusing on strategy, experience design, development and systems integration, our work is hinged on five key values: Transparency, Resilience, Problem-solving, Energy, and Curiosity.  We have a reputation for innovation and creating long-term partnerships with customers such as Emirates Airlines, American Express, Kaiser Permanente, Westfield, Telstra, 7-Eleven, New Look, Service NSW & DIRECTV.
Our People are our culture and that is what makes us unique. Founded in 2003 with a team spanning 10 global offices and counting, we are excited to continue supporting businesses #TheTigerspikeWay.

So what happens next?

Title: Data Scientist

Requirements:
This role is a position within the eTrading Application Production team in Singapore that is part of the global APS e-Solutions group (Application Production & Support) representing eTrading and eCommerce stakeholders in the region. The team provides platform and infrastructure management for all front office Electronic Solutions systems, which consist of more than 50 Electronic trading and eCommerce applications hosted on approximately 500 Windows and Linux servers in Asia Pacific and 1000’s worldwide.
The team also manages and supports Forex, Rates and Credit Direct Market Access (DMA) adaptors and their downstream dependencies. These adaptors connect to more than 20 electronic trading venues such as EBS, Reuters, JPX, ASX, SGX and Tradeweb as well as a number of external facing clients. 
Team members require a strong understanding of eTrading systems using a broad range of skills such as Linux and Windows operating systems, externally connecting TCP/IP networks including multicast, firewalls, databases and eCommerce industry standard technologies such as load balancers and proxy servers.
Team members are required to liaise with functional application support, development, IT infrastructure teams as well as business stakeholders while managing technical projects, resolving incidents, solving problems and fulfilling requests.
The systems that the global team supports are based in in London, New York, Tokyo and Singapore and most of them are live 24/5.5, so close interaction with global counterparts occur on a daily basis
Direct Responsibilities
Ownership of Production systems:
 Hands on technical support for the FX, Rates and Credit global trading platforms.
 Work with counterparts in London, Mumbai and New York to provide a follow the sun  support model while taking responsibility for the management of incidents and resulting problems that occur in London and New York platforms during Asian hours.
 Responsible for ensuring local monitoring, capacity / performance management and automation of local systems as a part of a global framework.
 Plan, schedule, implement and document the change activities as well as troubleshooting incidents and resolving problems.
 Work with autonomy and independence but within the framework of a global support structure.
Contributing Responsibilities
 Application integration, technical project management and implementation of the new requirements for applications and infrastructure that are within the Electronic Solutions Infrastructure scope. (ION Trading + eFX and Credit in-house systems)
 Perform activities related to rollout of upgrades of existing services as well as coordinate and organize changes with external vendors, clients, markets and ECNs in Singapore, Japan and Australia.
 Plan, schedule, implement and document the change activities as well as troubleshooting incidents and resolving problems.
 Work closely with development teams, business analysts, architects and infrastructure teams to enhance existing platform. eg: resilience, BCP, system performance and low latency.
 Support and management of the regional messaging infrastructure used by the eTrading platforms. (Tibco RV multicast, in-house systems)
Technical & Behavioral Competencies
 Sound understanding of both Windows and Linux server Operating Systems with a particular focus on application implementation and troubleshooting as well as performance tuning, low latency, time synchronisation and Operating System connectivity.
 Good knowledge of TCP/IP networks with routing, multicast and multi-tiered firewall environments as there is a need to manage external connectivity to clients and exchanges via cross-connects and service providers.
 Able to troubleshoot applications from a TCP and multicast level including packet captures, firewall and network routing analysis.
 Ability to architect solutions that integrate trading applications into the existing environment while considering application failover and BCP, performance optimisation, latency and maximising the stability of the platform.
 Solid scripting and automation skills required with a DevOps mindset. Python, shell scripting and Blade Logic experience a plus.
 Experience in supporting and implementing a vendor based real time trading system such as ION trading.
 Knowledge of FX and Rates Electronic Trading business functionality and trade flow.
Specific Qualifications (if required)
 Linux, Windows or Cisco certifications would be an advantage
In addition to the skills and responsibilities mentioned in the JD, we’re looking for someone who has interest or exposure to data analytics.
One of the project he will be in charge of may require data science on how to effectively gather and communicate upstream achievements of the team.
